reviews.review_msg: Very clear but over-simplified lecture notes, even though the MTs and exams are based on the lecture notes.  I learned mostly from the TA. Dont bother getting the textbook, just study the notes, attend class, and bother the TA for help.  For the final, study early because he doesnt give out sample final answers. MUST ATTEND TUTORIAL TO SUCCESS

Simon only tests out of the notes. His notes are alright but he doesn't add much to them during class so it's hard to pay attention when the notes are right in front of you. Not a bad prof but could be better!
No Comments
He's great! Easy exams and nice-looking guy!
Easy class, fun teacher
The grading system for this course heavily relies on the Midterm and Final exams, which contribute 90% of the total grade.

The class was straight forward. The TA's were very unorganized and did not release assignment grades until the last week of class. Jane is kinda out there, but she's a nice woman. GO TO CLASS and ask questions. You'll do fine.
she is nice but the stuff she teaches are really hard. the TAs are helpful.

She knows her stuff. You need to attend classes as her notes are quite different from the textbook. Do not skip tutorials as questions discussed there are likely to come out in the exams. Her exams are not easy but if you study her notes, you should be fine

Class looked interesting, turned out to be boring. Lectures were decent, but she was unable to answer any student questions that weren't directly related to the slides. No real marking scheme, which wasn't really fair. She's not the worst, but she's not good.
best prof ever!! a super easy course

VERY NICE, PATIENT PROF!! His teaching style is awesome, easy tests and NO CURVES!!! Although the no curving part makes it hard to get an A+ or an A, but if you are aiming for a B+ or more, just take courses with him!

He is a patient and helpful person.. i like wut he wears every lec. His teaching style is also awesome. He only cares about how much you understand and how much time you spend on this course, and then you will get a good effort. He marking is really fair. Trust me!!

Memorize his notes word for word. The tutorial questions were harder than the midterm believe it or not. The class average was low for the midterm (I don't know why considering it was literally just re-iterating his notes). Yes his voice is monotone, but he tries to crack a joke once in  a while. "B/B+" for effort.

Boring lectures that do nothing to help you understand the material. Poor textbook choice as it is hardly used and not referenced at all. Adding 25 marks to midterms isn't going to help when the marking is scheme is based on whether you know EXACTLY the point as he stated. If you need to take this course, look elsewhere.
n/a
Horrible class, everyones failing. Don't take this class whatever you do. I don't think its a requirement for any program so no one should be taking this class. Lets boycott this ****

This guys marking scheme is ridiculus. Average on the second midterm was 51% and he says thats 3 semesters in a row now but he still doesn't want to curve the marks. I'm getting a B but could easily be gettin an A with a diff prof. The best mark in the class on both the midterms was around 75-80%. And the T.A. is an econ nazi. Really hard marking.

He has excellent notes. For exams, there is always something more he wants from your answers. He almost never gives out full marks. Class avg for the MTs are around 52% and 55%, and he won't really curve to help ppl.
No Comments

A very nice and easy going professor. exams are very fair and clear, just know the tutorial questions, but he is a very hard marker. Always draw a graph for every questions whether the qestion asks for it or not. on exams are from the notes, but u still need to study the text book.

worst prof ever.. doesnt know the material. very unorganized and confused. he ll write down a page of notes then cross them out.. he has no idea what hes doing, the material is interesting but hes a moron

A really good professor.. he may be picky in exams.. but if you understand what he wants in the questions you will do good.. concentrate on his notes, i didnt read the book and i got an A in his class.. try to have him as a TA as well it helps ...i think he is a great prof.. very helpfull and his exams are straight forward

always something more he wants in your answer!  He simply doesn't like to give full mark to any question. He get's easily pissed, just ask him to read your answer another time or remark your answer, then you will see how immat..e a prof can behave! not a very difficult course.

This guy's a total ****. Don't try to correct him, he's too insecure for that. Read like crazy. Avoid him if you can. He's very picky on the marking and then will claim that the class is lost. What a tool. Avoid him. Lame teacher. Nice personality. But lame teacher.

the material is not that difficult. but his exam marking is soooooo picky. also in the exam, only he asks is to memorize the whole thing in the note and write it down. JUST MEMORIZE.. that's the one thing he asks for,,,

Very nice & easy-going prof.! He will concenrate some questions during the lecture (tips for midterm). If u want to get A, read the textbook 1 time + his lecture notes (most of the questions u can find in the exam).

Course content is not easy, lectures are informative, if you think the text is useless, think again unless you only want a B. Marshall is amazing, nice instructor, fare profeesor, maybe little tough on exams but are curved. Read the text, focus on notes, you would get an A
Lectures are boring. Gives good notes. Questions are based on notes.
